reviews.review_msg: Kendra Strauss is a decent prof. Much of the course is participation and easy marks, but the final is 2 essays in a 36 hour timeframe before the semester is even over, which is ridiculous. That aside, the course is really reading and writing heavy, and the readings are overall pretty boring tbh. Course should really be labelled LBST 101W

Amazing. Absolutely amazing. Coming from a STEM background, Dr. Strauss's teaching style made concepts stick in my brain. I found myself reflecting on my day to day life, and Kendra really emphasized reflection and application of course concepts. if you take notes, finish assignments on time, its easy to do well.
Professor Strauss is an excellent and knowledgeable instructor. Her passion for her subjects is contagious, her lectures are relevant and interesting. HIghly recommend taking any of her classes.

Online class with excessive amounts of readings each week. 4 textbooks but you can go through the class without opening 3 of them until the open book final. Papers and discussion questions allow for easy marks.
Kendra is wonderful!!!! One of the best profs and best classes I've ever had. She is incredibly smart, kind, clear and helpful. I loved LBST 101 - it was so interesting and so easy.

Kendra is an amazing lady. You can tell how smart she is. You really feel like she's teaching you. She's friendly and helpful. Everything is clear, the assignments and tests are literally so easy. She makes you think about labour and work in a different way.
EASY TO GET A.
Ben is super approachable and gives amazing feedback. Plus he tries to incorporate current events into the learning material. Just make an effort and do the work, he will definitely recognize it.
Ben is a very nice person. He is also engaging and turns boring stuff fun.
Best professor I meet, all you need is paying attention in class and reading related articles. He gave great feedbacks after each assignment. You can learn a LOT in his class.

Mr. Ivan is a great professor and his lectures are very intriguing. There is, however, a lot of reading so make sure you're up for that. If you study well and really understand the readings and can explain them properly in your words you'll get an A.

I took a 2nd year english course with her at ubco and found her to be a really harsh marker. Her feedback was always very minimal and often didn't even relate to the rubric grading. She also takes very long to grade work. On the other hand, she does provide time for late submissions without taking marks off and is a respectable and accessible prof.

I loved Dr. Breshears! She's currently at UBCO and I took an English composition class from her. She gave me awesome feedback and took into consideration our workload and adjusted deadlines to better suit our needs. Very accommodating & listens to what you say, and gives great clarification. Her grading rubrics are clear and easily obtainable.

Sherry is a gem! She marks very fairly and gives good feedback on your work. Most of your work will be marked by the TA, but she will check in with them. Her lectures are very interesting and relevant to labour in todays world. Love that she incorporated indigenous materials in the curriculum. TAKE THE CLASS WITH HER! A- class average.

Great prof! Very insightful lectures and exercises. A great intro to labour studies that really expanded my horizons. Very fair marking and feedback. Also very cheap, accessible textbook (available at Indigo!) and lots of local history about Indigenous labour and BC labour history in general that was very valuable. Would highly recommend!

Concepts were super easy to understand and her lectures would focus on the important parts of the readings, so you don't even have to fully read all of the readings because she summarizes them perfectly. Midterm and final were easy and focused on exactly what she said they would be on. When classes moved online she handled it really well.

Professor Encalada is so passionate and inspiring; you can almost feel her commitment to social justice when she talks. There is a lot of reading, but they're all relevant and really help you understand the course themes. Her feedback is helpful.
Evelyn is amazing, knowledgeable and easy-going. Her feedback significantly improved my ability to write and analyze. Super easy evaluations and readings.

Evelyn is a great professor, but if you're not very interested in the subject of labour issues and relevant theory, or are taking it as a credit booster, her course might not be for you. The classes are very reading-heavy, but supplemented by expertise on the subject of migrant labour issues. Talk to her if you don't understand something!

professor enclada is an amazing writer and activist.. but lecturing is just not her forte. interesting content but quite repetitive and with enclada as a professor prepare to absorb little of it. she is a very caring and respectable person however she bounces from topic to topic and spends more time rambling than actually teaching....

so many readings that is clearly not a 100 level
reading summaries each week
feedback is not good

Is passionate and amazing having a professor that loves the subject she teaches. Downside gets into the lecture that there are no breaks. Provides readings and videos for ways of learning. Professor practice what she preaches. You can see her work and experience in her lecture. She is involved in many actions for migrant workers and worker rights.

Makes you buy a textbook but it's only used for one reading (and it had to be bought as we submitted reading responses for grades). lectures are long without breaks and all over the place. very rarely is there a good flow. readings are very long as well and one of our assigned readings was the same as my 300 level class. do not take with this prof.
